task.title: Setting a reference grid
task.shortdesc: A reference grid displays as a pattern of regularly spaced cells. You can turn the display on and of , and you can specify how far apart the cells are spaced.

context.p: The reference grid extends only to the limits of the drawing, helping you to visualize the boundary of your drawing and to align entities and visualize distances between entities. You can turn the grid on and off as needed. You can also change the spacing of the grid at any time.
To turn the grid on and set the grid spacing

step.cmd: Choose Tools > Drafting Settings from the main menu.
Under Grid tab, input a value in the Grid X Spacing field and Grid Y Spacing field separately.

result.p: Status bar Right-click on the Grid Display button to choose Settings.
TIP To toggle the grid display on and off at any time, click the Grid Display button on the status bar, or press F7.
